html:
Ariana Grande will be in the new movie Meet the Parents 4. She joins a cast featuring original Meet the Parents stars Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, and Blythe Danner. The movie is expected to hit theaters on Wednesday, November 25, 2026, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

The first Meet the Parents movie came out in 2000. The sequel, Meet the Fockers, was released in 2004, and the third film in the franchise, Little Fockers, arrived in 2010. The new Meet the Parents is being written and directed by John Hamburg.

In a recent interview with Variety, one of the film’s producers, Jane Rosenthal, gave a glimpse into Meet the Parents 4. “Ben Stiller is now the same age that Bob [De Niro] was when we did the first one,” she said, “and his kids have grown up, and they have to come home and meet the parents. I can’t disclose anything else about the plot.”

Universal Pictures is releasing Meet the Parents 4. The studio is behind Wicked and the forthcoming Wicked: For Good, both of which star Ariana Grande.
